title: ESPN Get Up — Studio X at 7 Hudson Square

gallery.caption: Curved anchor desk with integrated LED inlay
Subway tile and mosaic elements for NYC authenticity
Custom Manhattan epoxy table for segments

summary: Creating the ultimate sports hangout in Lower Manhattan. The custom epoxy table depicting Lower Manhattan serves Mike Greenberg's 'Big Man, Tiny Helmets' segment while reinforcing the studio's New York identity.
challenge: ESPN's morning show needed a new home that better reflected its conversational format. The design team drew inspiration from beloved TV gathering places like Central Perk from 'Friends' and the diner from 'Seinfeld.'
approach: Mystic worked with MPK Scenic to translate the 'classic TV hangout' concept into physical elements. The centerpiece is a custom poured resin 'river table' depicting Lower Manhattan, plus subway tile installations, ESPN mosaic wall, and curved anchor desk with LED screen inlay.
result: Studio X launched June 9, 2025, successfully transitioning 'Get Up' to Lower Manhattan. Column-free sightlines eliminated camera obstructions that plagued the previous location.

testimonial.quote: We wanted that kind of feel for 'Get Up,' for Greeny and his show — like Central Perk or the Seinfeld diner.
testimonial.author: Joe Ferretti
testimonial.title: Director of Studio Design & Development
